repnme.cdata!:
China - Shanghai Port Restructuring and
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project is rated as highly
            satisfactory, and is considered sustainable. Significant
            changes occurred in China's port sector since 1982,
            when major port authorities were decentralized, and joint
            venture container-terminal operations, first started with
            foreign operators in Shanghai, and other neighboring ports,
            creating competition. There is now an awareness of the vital
            role of the port as a link with rails, and roads, thus
            policy coordination, at the central government level, needs
            to be strengthened to improve Shanghai's multi-modal
            transport efficiency. The key lessons convey that, given the
            competitiveness environment created thus far, further Bank
            assistance is worth considering for port sub-sector
            activities, since evidence suggests that the Shanghai Port
            Authority (SPA) performance at the Waigaoqiao terminal, was
            indeed better than the Shanghai Container Terminal,
            indicative that the compatibility existing between public
            sector performance, and that of joint ventures, is at par.
            It is worth noting that, the SPA's experience, and
            familiarity with Bank operations, greatly contributed to
            this successful implementation, easing the way in
            procurement procedures, and compliance with legal covenants.
            Furthermore, staff continuity proved successful as well,
            where a multi-disciplinary team was maintained.

5077602.trustfund: TF023450-CANADIAN CONSULTANT TF FOR ENVIRONMENT,TF020350-DANISH CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND,TF033476-CHINA - TRANSPORT,TF031351-CHINA - TARIFF RESTRUCTURING
5077602.majtheme: Financial and private sector development,Environment and natural resource management

repnme.cdata!:
China - Shanghai Port Restructuring and
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project objectives are to assist the
            Shanghai Port Authority in: (a) rationalizing the long-term
            development of the port by gradually shifting operations
            away from the city center and by promoting terminal
            specialization, (b) providing needed additional capacity in
            an optimal, environmentally sound way, and (c) increasing
            efficiency by introducing modern methods of operational and
            financial management. The project will consist of: (1)
            formulation and implementation of an action plan for
            restructuring the existing port facilities on the Huangpu
            river to rationalize their use and move cargo operations
            away from the city center, (2) provision of new and
            replacement cargo handling equipment for existing terminals,
            (3) measures to improve the Port Authority's financial
            condition through tariff restructuring and other measures,
            (4) construction of new terminals at Waigaoqiao and Luojing
            on the Yangtze river, and installation of the necessary
            cargo handling equipment, and (5) technical assistance and training.

docna.cdata!:
China - Shanghai Port Restructuring and
            Development Project

China - Shanghai Port
